Authors:
Preuttiporn Supaphon, Sita Preedanon, Chutima
Kaewpiboon
Title:
Evaluation of antimicrobial and antioxidant activities of
endophytic fungi isolated from Helianthus annuus
Keywords:
Endophytuc fungi, Antimicrobial activity, Antioxidant
activity, Helianthus annuus
Abstract:
This research aims to evaluate the antimicrobial and
antioxidant activities of crude extracts from endophytic fungi isolated
from Helianthus annuus. All fungal isolates were extracted with hexane
and ethyl acetate. Three crude extracts (cell ethyl acetate, cell hexane
and broth ethyl acetate) were evaluated for their antimicrobial and
antioxidant activities by using a colorimetric broth microdilution test
and DPPH free radical scavenging assay, respectively. Eight pathogenic
bacteria were used in the antimicrobial test including, Staphylococcus
aureus, Methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli,
Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Candida albicans and Cryptococcus neoformans.
Ethy acetate extract from fungal isolate EF_HA3 and EF_HA9 were the most
active against S. Aureus and MRSA with MIC 16, MBC or MFC 32 Âµg/ml.
Furthermore, these extracts had the strongest antioxidant activity with
EC50 1.15 mg/ml. These results showed that crude extracts from
endophytic fungi isolated from Helianthus annuus are interesting because
they are a good source of many active metabolites for future
applications.
